content.description: Find the common sloper start with a square foothold on the trail side. Move left through a tricky crux to a rising rail.VARIATION: Sit start off the squarish hold and pop up to the big sloper. Hold it! .. continue on V9 - FA Matt Giossi.

climbs.name: Sub Zero
climbs.fa: Ty Landman Stand/ Troy Fauteux Sit

content.description: Just left of GZ, Starting sitting on the rail, move left hand on a sloping cookie and fire to the sloping rail up and right, hard match. Top out. Stand start goes at V9/10.

Full crimp the half crescent moon with your right hand and rest your left hand on the small dish spoon. Establish (crux) and huck for the lip (not crux). This is an eliminate!!!! Only the spoon and the moon are on for hands. Can also be done statically. Admittedly, this problem is really contrived-- it's easier (v1) to jump no hands from the ground to the top of the boulder. But, this is still pretty fun
content.location: On the lost boulder on the face to the right of ground zero

climbs.name: Party Tricks
climbs.fa: Back in the day, Marc Troob?

content.description: Starting on the right side of the face around right of Ground Zero, stand start and do a move off some crimps or jump to the lip and hand traverse it all the way around left, topping out at Finder's Keepers. Silly, but a good pump on slopers.
content.location: Just around the corner to the left and on the other side of a tree from the easiest down climb. Lip traverse the boulder, moving left around the prow of Ground Zero and over the to Finders Keepers top out.

content.description: Common sloper start, move staight up to sidepulls, the rounded arete and a hard reach to the top.

Sit start, with hands on the lowest rail under the cave. Climb up on perfect stone using flakes to pop out to the sloping pinch out right, then dyno for a good edge up right and top out. The grade is based on a full sit start, as it was originally done. Fun but easier if a tripod start is used (V9+)
content.location: Under the steepest part of the boulder.

content.description: Start on two decent edges to the right of Ground Zero and dyno up and left to a good hold on the lip. Easy topout.Starting from Ground Zero and transitioning into this dyno after making the crux throw to the arete on GZ is called "Golden Hour" (Peter Torphy FA V11)
content.location: Around the corner on the right of Ground Zero.

climbs.name: Finders Keepers
climbs.fa: Mike Galoob, Marc Troob - sit start

content.location: Find an incut flake on the leaning face, fire to juggy knobs.

content.description: Sit start matched on foot for Notochord and finish Notochord's arete.   Requires a dyno and difficult catch onto the usual sloper stand start.

Same as Drive By, but continue to the right side of the jug flake then do a move up and right to a similar fun flake and mantle finish as the left version, but slightly pumpier. Do both to keep your arms balanced.

Start at the common sloper start, move right to another sloper, then drive by or campus into a juggy flake that looks like a climbing shoe or gangster mobile, depending on your frame of mind. Do a big move up left from here to nice rounded incut flake and an honest top out. A great route. All the holds make you smile.

Between the descent route and Summit or Die - Step off one of the Lost Boulder's children and slab your way up sandstone like foot scoops and slopers. Avoiding the flake to the left and just using the slopers is slightly contrived, but makes for a better problem IMO. Balance

Good sized bloc of varying heights and amazing rock quality; beautiful slopers, incut flakes and perfect texture. Originally found by Dana Seaton and Mike Galoob in 1999 after getting lost in the woods. Problems range from v1 to v11-12. Note - this is a superb boulder so has gotten some attention by exuberant groups. Though it may seem you are way out in the woods by yourself due to the long indirect approach, you are actually well within earshot of a residence. Please keep your noise level to a minimum and leave the boulder cleaned of tick marks. If you do your part to rake the leaves off the top it will help for a dry visit the next time too. This boulder is on DEM land, but a private property border is just up the trail. (see comments below)This boulder is best visited during the prime cool dry season, as it can get very buggy and jungle like feeling in the heat of Summer. Wear plenty of orange during hunting season, seriously. Some of you have been in hunters sights without having a clue.
